reviews.review_msg: Gary Parker is a responsible and nice professor. Time series is a very difficult concept in the statistics industry, but he explained it very well. There are mathematical questions in the course that are tough but very helpful for us to understand the concept. Gary sacrifices his precious time for those students who are struggling with the course.
Lots of theories and calculations, but most of the time you don't understand them. Even though I got a B, I didn't really learn anything

Extremely boring lectures, extremely boring. He spends so much time explaining theoretical materials which is practically useless and most students, like me, forget everything he teaches the day after his final exam. Let's be real, who is going to calculate auto-correlation manually with a pen and paper when everything is done by computer nowadays

Gary's class covers diverse topics, often lacking continuity. Quizzes and midterms are strict, with stringent process requirements and little credit for partial work. Both teaching and grading need refinement. Attendance and proactive homework are crucial for success here."
Hard test. The scoring criteria are extremely unfair. Obvious errors in his notes. The tutorials are useless.
